choices: Your not flying, but riding in an aircraft
1.content: Who are you and what are you flying?
1.title: Who are you?

11.content: You get out of your bunk and get dressed in your pilot flight suit and grab your helmet, as you walk outside you remember you are stationed in a:
11.title: Military. Flying a helicopter

111.content:
As you walk out the door you remember you are stationed out in the sweltering heat of a desert. " Hey Mike wait up" you hear behind you, you turn around and see your co-pilot running up to you. "What's up?" You ask as he nears, " we got a new guy in the bird today, some special forces combat medic I think" he says. "On a routine flight?" you ask confused, the co-pilot shrugs and walks with you toward your BlackHawk on the tarmac. As you approach the helicopter you see standing there was a soldier in combat fatigues with an M14 marksmen rifle and a large medical bag, "you must be my unexpected passenger?" you ask. "Thats me. Sergeant Durrant" he says holding out a hand, "you plan on shooting anything from my bird with that?" you ask pointing to the M14.

Durrant laughs, "no to be honest I like using one of these " he says pointing to one of the M240Bs mounted on the side of the BlackHawk., "Well get snapped in we're taking off soon" you tell him, he nods and climbs in the helicopter while you and the other three crew members run a check over the BlackHawk. After and hour of checking the systems you climb into the cockpit and start up the engines, fifteen minutes later and you were flying over the desert, "whats that?" asks the co-pilot pointing out the cockpit window, you follow his finger and see what looks like a person standing off in the distance. "It looks like a person, but I thought this part of the desert was un-inhabited?" you say confused, "it is" says Durrant on the headset.

"Lets go check it out, they may be lost" you say turning towards the figure in the distance, but as you near the figure you see multiple warning lights blink on the instrument panel. Suddenly the BlackHawk gave a hard shudder and started flying erratically and dropping altitude, despite your best efforts the helicopter was still plummeting towards the ground, "brace for a hard landing" you yelled as you neared the sandy ground. The last thing you remember was someone screaming a name before crashing nose first into the ground, knocking you unconscious. When you come to you find yourself still strapped to your seat, you look to your left and see your co-pilot still there, you reach over and check his pulse: still beating, you look over your shoulder and see the two crew chiefs sprawled out on the floor and judging from the fact that they were still breath, also alive, but Durrant was nowhere to be seen.

You hear faint footsteps outside, like someone walking in the sand, you reach down and unsnap your MP5K from your leg holster, pull on the charging handle and take aim out the door. Standing there was........
111.title: Desert

choices: The sound of claws on metal grabs your attention
One of the crew chiefs find you
113.content:
You open the door to your barrack and look around at the lush, green forest surrounding the small encampment, you inhale deeply, enjoying the smell of the fresh pine in the air. "Couldn't ask for a better place to work, clear weather, no city noise," you say to yourself, you walk to the hanger that had the Blackhawk helicopter that you pilot inside. As you walk inside your two crew chiefs were looking the helicopter over for any defects, "good to go?" you ask, both crew chiefs gave you a thumbs up. You climb inside and begin the start up sequence for the main rotor, five minutes later you were rolling down the tarmac, an hour later you here flying at a steady speed over the forest.

"Hey Bryan take the stick for a minute" you say to your co-pilot as you check your location on the NAV. "Ok in an hour turn left 30 degrees and keep flying straight for another half hour and then we can begin testing to see if those techs fixed that tail rotor" you say. Just before you begin the stress test on the new rotor a warning light appeared flashing, WARN ROTOR FAIL on the instrument panel, "alright we're turning around, Bryan try to find us a clear area if we need to make a hard landing" you say to your co-pilot. "OK there's a clearing about a mile from here" says the co-pilot pointing on the NAV, you steer the BlackHawk toward it and for an hour you fight with the helicopter to keep it on course as it was veering left and right randomly.

Soon you had the BlackHawk flying at a height of about eight feet over a large clearing, "alright on three bail" you say, "one...two....three! Go" you shout. As soon as you shouted three, the two crew chiefs and co-pilot bailed out, but as you go to bail out you become snagged on something preventing you from bailing out. As you try to free yourself you see that the BlackHawk was nearing some trees, forcing you to pull up. You bring the helicopter back around in an attempt to try again, but before you could finish the turn there was an loud bang followed by the helicopter going into an out of control spin, the last thing you remember was the helicopter loosing altitude and then the sound of trees striking the nose before blacking out.

When you come to you find the BlackHawk laying on the forest floor in many pieces, with you still in the cockpit. You attempt to get out of your seat, but a sharp pain in your lower left abdomen area stops you, you look and see that a piece of the main rotor blades had broken off and stabbed you, literally nailing you to your seat.
113.title: Forest

1132.content:
You reach down with two hands and tug on the piece of metal keeping you pinned to your seat, but just touching the shard causes pain in your side. You inhale deeply and try agin, but again the pain stopped you, suddenly you hear a new noise making you stop. You hear a sound that reminded you of a dog walking across a hardwood floor, the sound of their claws/nails tapping on the floor. You look around and try to find the source of the noise, but as quick as it came, it was gone, "odd" you say to yourself. Suddenly you feel a presence to your left, like someone was standing next to you, slowly you turn and look over our shoulder.

Staring at you was a large, gray wolf, slowly you reach toward your sidearm, but as you touch the pistol the wolf let out a low growl, stopping you. Very carefully you move your hand away from the holster, "don't know which is worse, getting injured in this crash, or that wolf killing me" you say quietly to yourself. The wolf walks over to you and starts sniffing you, starting at your face and working its way down, stopping at the piece of metal in your side.

As the wolf checked you out, you did some checking yourself, after seeing no visible genitalia you determine that the wolf was female. Her fur was a mix of gray with light streaks of white and brown fur in her underbelly, you notice that her right ear was a little torn up with a small scar down her muzzle. The wolf stopped sniffing you and looked back at you with bright blue eyes, suddenly she.......
1132.title: The sound of claws on metal grabs your attention

11323.content:
The wolf turned toward the shattered cockpit windshield and let out a howl that went on for a full minute, suddenly you hear something rustling in the nearby bushes. As the noise got closer you contemplated your sidearm again, but you knew the wolf might stop you with more than a growl this time. You look out the windshield expecting another wolf to jump on the nose of the helicopter, but none did. Suddenly you feel something brush against your boot, you look and see a small fox climbing through the smashed nose bubble at you feet and climb up on your lap.

Like the wolf, the fox started to sniff at your face and work its way down, stopping at the metal shard. The fox lightly bit the shard which sent a tingle of pain up your side, "aahh please don't do that" you say to the fox. The wolf lets out a small growl to the fox, the fox climbs off you and the two disappear behind you, suddenly you feel the shard start to move, "hey please don't touch th--" before you could finish you hear a snap followed by you being freed from the chair. You look over and see the wolf with a piece of the rotor shard in her mouth, you carefully climb out of the cockpit , taking care not to smack the piece of rotor that was still in your side into anything.

You find a tree and lean against it , you look back and see the wolf and fox staring at you from the helicopter side door. You look down at the remains of the shrapnel, it stuck out about one foot in front of you and stuck out about four inches from your backside. You look at it and contemplate pulling it out, if you leave it in your risk infection,and if you pull it out you risk reopening any plugged arteries.......
11323.title: Howls

113232.content:
You decide to leave the shard of rotor rather than risk unplugging any arteries that may have been sliced open during the crash. You get to your feet and make your way to the Blackhawk to search for any useful gear, you took extra care to keep an eye on the wolf and fox still sitting in the back of the helicopter, silently observing you. You manage to recover a small bundle of survival gear consisting of your sidearm, boot knife, two MREs, a canteen, and other miscellaneous items, but no useable radio, you gather the gear and begin to leave. You turn and look at the fox and wolf, who were still unmoved, and wave goodbye, "thanks for not making a meal out of me I guess" you say to them as you leave. You continue walking for an hour, stopping every so often to check on your wounded side, soon you come to a clearing with a large lake in the middle, you take a moment to clean yourself up and to refill your canteen. The sound of a twig snapping draws your attention, you spin around, hand on your holster, scanning for any signs of what made that noise.

"Probably a deer" you say to yourself, just then you spot.......
113232.title: Leave it

114.content:
You look out the windshield at the vast jungle below, "this is odd" your co-pilot says from his seat, "what is?" you ask, "this jungle doesn't show up on these maps" he says pointing to the paper map in his hand. That was the downside to flying an older helicopter like the Huey, no GPS built in, you had to use paper maps to navigate, but it was better than nothing. "What do you mean its not on the map?" you ask, "I mean the jungle was supposed to end 30 miles back" he says, suddenly you feel a large vibration in the pedals at your feet followed by a small electrical spark on the instrument panel, "whoa! What was that?" you say, "I don't know but its gone" says the co-pilot. Just then without warning the whole helicopter lurched like a large foot just dropkicked the tail, putting the Huey in an out of control spin. Klaxons and light blew up all over the instrument panels, "collective's not responding, hydraulics are out!" you shout over the alarms, the Huey did a belly flop in the one open clearing in the whole jungle, the force of the impact sent a pain through your lower back.

The helicopter hit so hard that it bounced back into the air and rolled over to the left, the rotor blade snapped as the came into contact with the hard pack jungle ground. The Huey continued its roll and came to a rest on its roof, leaving you upside down in your chair., You look over at your co-pilot who had already freed himself and was making his way over to you, suddenly the smell of fuel assaults your nose. You free yourself and tumble out of your seat, but you can't open your door, "get me outta here!" you yell, the co-pilot starts yanking on your door while you start pushing from the other side. "Try kicking it" he says, "I can't move my legs" you tell him, he swears before grabbing a piece of rotor and starts using it like a pry bar and manages to pry the door open, grab you by the scruff of your vest and drag you away from the wreck before the fuel catches on fire, causing the helicopter to explode.

"too close" you say quietly, "you can say that again" says the co-pilot, "let's check out your legs" he says. He examines your back and legs, "well I've got good news and bad news" he says, "just give it to me" you say, "well the good news is that your inability to use your legs appears temporary, but thats were the bad news come in, I don't know how long temporary is" he says. "Great" you say, "well I'm going to get started on building a shelter while there is still light out and we just sit tight and wait I guess" says your co-pilot. For about five hours you are forced to sit against a tree and watch while the co-pilot build a small camp for the two of you to stay in, every so often you would check behind you to make sure no wildlife was stalking up behind you, despite the felling of being watched you found nothing. By the time your new home was built the sun was dipping behind the hills to the west, the co-pilot had a good fire going and a fairly large shelter built from anything he could get his hands on, even some pieces from the wreck. He picks you up and carries you to the fire pit and sets you down against another tree where the two of you have some of your emergence rations, "you get some sleep, I'll take first watch" you say to the co-pilot, he gives you a tired smile and nods, an hour later he was asleep in the lean to and you were alert for any animals that might try to attack during the night and to keep an eye out for any rescue planes overhead......
114.title: Jungle

12.content: This is the furthest you've ever flown this little biplane, but it was holding up rather well. At least, until it wasn't. Quite suddenly, your engine shudders. What sort of terrain are you flying over?
12.title: Civilian. Flying a plane

choices: ...You see what appears to be a campsite with many tents.
...You see a pyramid with an entrance.
...You see a small village with a well.
125.content:
Your engine shudders again, and before you can react, it loses power. You're still gliding though, and in control. The desert stretches out flat before you, and while the landing conditions are hardly ideal, as far as crashes go, you're counting your blessings. You can drop lower much too quickly, and you can hear rocks and plants hit your craft, a sound which would normally be obscured by the propeller, which has stopped. The plane jolts as you bump the ground once, twice, before coasting into a cactus and finally stopping. The particularly large cactus is torn apart by the collision, and the quick stop causes you to bounce painfully. There's a horrible scraping sound just before the plane stops, caused by the cactus and tumbleweeds.

You climb out of the plane and look yourself over, finding no obvious injuries. You then decide to check the plane. One of the blades on the propeller as snapped, and another is bent. The bottom of the plane has been scratched, but the damage seems superficial. You hold a hand near the front of the plane, not quite touching it, but close enough to tell it would be hot to the touch. You decide to wait to check the engine until nightfall, when things have cooled down.

It is then that the heat makes itself known. You are suddenly acutely aware of the midday sun beaming down on you, reflecting off the sand and becoming blinding. You reach into the plane and retrieve a backpack with some basic supplies. A couple of water bottles, some trail mix and candy bars, a flashlight, a rope, a multitool, a first aid kit, clothes, and some matches. You resist the urge to drink the water right away, and fashion a hat out of one of your shirts.

You recognize quickly that your plane will not provide adequate shade. You set off in the direction of the sun, in the hopes that it will help you find your plane again later. You walk for perhaps half an hour without seeing anything, but then...
125.title: Desert

choices: The child responds in a language you don't know.
1253.content:
You step forward, but you don't drink from the well. Not yet. You don't know if the villagers would be upset by it, or indeed if there is anyone in the village. For all you know, someone poisoned the well and all the citizens drank from it and died. Instead you drink a few sips from one of your water bottles and entertain that silly line of thought a little bit longer.

You put the bottle back into your backpack, and walk through the village. The outskirts are quiet, but as you go deeper into the village, you start to see signs of life. You hear voices, and see movements behind windows. You pass another well. You round a corner toward the sound of some children playing and...

You stop.

The creatures in front of you are undoubtedly children's, and they have yet to notice you, as they're engaged in a fierce game of tag. They are dressed in simple clothing, light in color, and designed to keep out the heat. They seem to be, by almost all accounts, to be ordinary children. But they're covered in fur, and they have faces that resemble animals, as well as tails and paws. You recognize two jackrabbits and a hyena. Before you can do much of anything one of the children, this one a coyote, bumps into you. The child looks up at you, seeming stunned. You say the first thing that comes to mind.

"Um, excuse me."
1253.title: ...You see a small village with a well.

choices: She takes you to a large building in the center of the village.
She takes you inside the building she first came out of.
12532.content:
You think at first that the coyote child is speaking Spanish, but you realize pretty quickly that you're wrong. Whatever the child says is intoned in such a way that it sounds like a question. By now, other children have gathered around. You don't know what to do, and so you respond as best as you can.

"I'm sorry, I don't know what you're saying."

The coyote child then turns to his friends, and they speak quickly among each other for a while. The coyote turns back and signals you to 'wait' with his paws. You feel a bit relieved that you're able to recognize the gesture. One of the jackrabbits runs into a nearby house, and returns with and older jackrabbit woman who you assume to be her mother. The younger jackrabbit gestures excitedly to you and speaks in a rushed tone. Her mother shushes her as she approaches you. The mother asks you a question, longer than what they coyote had asked. You respond with "I don't understand." She looks at you with a perplexed expression for a while before pointing at herself and saying "Sayo Anya." You figure that she's introducing herself, so you do the same. You point to yourself and say your name as clearly as you can manage. She nods and says something that includes the name you just told her and gestures for you to follow.
12532.title: The child responds in a language you don't ...

13.content: Your a F22-Raptor pilot named Rook, getting ready for take off. Doing basic flight checks and maintenance checks, Then you set out with your orders. Take a sweep of the follow area not known to any man. Anyone who gone in, didn't come out. You were daring enough (or forced) to go on the mission. You had a co pilot named John with you, a long good friend. "Delta-1 ready for take off". "Delta-1 you are cleared go go go". A loud explosive sounded as you took off then another came as you past the sound barrier. You were just about to enter the area when a dial flashed. "John Heat Signatures"!" ."I'm on it just do evasive maneuvers". You did your best than the flare system jammed. Your jet jerked hard, you were hit."ROOK EJECT". John ejected but then the canopy closed back down. You ejected and smashed through it and were knocked out. As you looked around you saw you were in.
13.title: Military. Flying a plane

14.content:
You sigh to yourself as you run your hand over your personal helicopter, just when you thought the day couldn't get any worst it did, first it started with your girlfriend of two years leaving you, then you lost your job followed by your car getting towed off. With the loss of your job meant you are going to have problems making ends meet for rent and food, which if you don't find a job soon you're going to get evicted in a month, the only thing that you had left really was your helicopter, but in a week the bank was going to repo it because according to them you were in-debt for some unpaid bills that you never heard about until a week ago. "Screw it, if the bank was going to take the chopper lets have one more hurrah" you say to yourself, you climb in and begin the start up sequence, get clearance from the tower and take off with no particular destination in mind.

About an hour later you look out and see you were flying over.......
14.title: Civilian. Flying a helicopter

choices: Try to reach higher ground for the night
141.content:
After flying around for about an hour you find yourself over a vast forest, above you the sun had just passed its half way point and was beginning its slow descent into night. Aside from the helicopter's low thrum, it was peaceful above the forest, this was one of the many reasons why you enjoyed flying, it got you away from all your problems back home. A light above the fuel gauge light up, indicating that the tank was almost half way empty, "I guess all good things must come to an end sometime" you say to yourself as you turn back to the airport.

Just then a warning light came on indicating that one of the engines had a fire, you pull on the fire extinguisher lever and shut down the engine. The helicopter could fly on one engine, but not very well, so you had to get back to the airport quick. Suddenly he instrument panel went dark, but all the gauges still worked, unfortunately your navigation and radio stopped working when the panel stopped functioning.

"Can this day get any worse?" you say to yourself, just then you hear a loud grinding noise emanate from the engine followed by smoke lightly start to fill the cockpit. The altimeter, airspeed, and RPM gauges start to count down, you swear as you realize whats happening, you spot a clearing in the trees so you steer the helicopter towards it while you still had control. Just as you come in for a landing the helicopter suddenly tilts on its left side, you bring your arms up and shield your face as the helicopter rolls onto is side and the rotor blade explode when they hit the ground. Finally the helicopter comes to a rest, you grab the survival kit that you kept under the seat and climb out of the wreck. You look into the sky and see that the sun was beginning to set over the mountains
141.title: A forest

choices: On your knees with a bag over your head
1412.content:
You decide that the best thing to do right now is to reach higher ground so in the morning you can get your bearings and so you could signal any passing aircraft. You shoulder your survival bag and start the long trek up the nearest mountain, but just as you reach the bottom of the mountain, something wraps around your legs and yanks you up into the air.

You look up and see that you had set off some type of snare, you look at the ground and see your bag laying just out of reach. You try to grab it anyways because there was a knife in the outer pocket, but no matter how hard you try, you could reach it. Suddenly you hear the bushes nearby rustle and out steps five figures,but it was too dark for you to see them clearly, "uhh...hi. can you get me down?" you ask.

You hear a puff of air and a small pain in your side followed by your vision darkening, when you come to your find yourself......
1412.title: Try to reach higher ground for the night

14121.content:
You open your eyes and find yourself on some sort of bed that was made out of animal pelts, you look around and you find yourself in some sort of hut. Suddenly the door, which was just an animal hide draped over the doorway, was 'opened' and in stepped something you never conceived as being real. Standing in the doorway was a human or rather an animal, actually it was more of a combination of the two; an animal with human qualities. You sit there in shock, starring at the strange figure, everything from the long bushy tail to the furry, pointed ears that sat atop its head, unfortunately it was too dark for you to determine gender and to see finer details like the animal's breed.

Just then you remembered how you got here, the snare and the dart. quickly you scramble off the bed and run into the farthest corner and drop into a fetal position. "Please don't hurt me, I'm lost and I just want to go home, I didn't mean to intrude or anything" you plead with the creature. The creature tilts its head in confusion, "maybe it doesn't understand English" you think to yourself, "why would I hurt you human?' it says in a female voice, "ok they understand me" you think to yourself. Slowly you start to stand up cautiously, "well umm...." you start, unsure what to say now that you know this animal/human, isn't...well animal. "Well what?' she asks, slowly walking over to you, "well I was caught in a trap and tranquilized before being brought here, I'm sorry if I'm being rude, but I sort of expected to be cut up like a steak" you say. The female giggles at your response, "no offense taken, but you must understand, we may be animal in nature, but we are very civilized" she says, "I'm sorry, but we haven't been properly introduced, my name is (your name)" you say, slowly walking out of the corner, "well (your name) I am Kayla and I am sorry about having to dart you like that" she says.

As she moved into the light you could see she was a dark gray wolf with a streak of white going from her nose and over her head, like racing stripes on a car. She gave you a friendly smile which calmed you down enough to come out of the corner and make your way over to her, "why am I here?" you ask, "well........"
14121.title: In a bedroom

15.content: OK, so same thing, who are you and what are you riding in?
15.title: Your not flying, but riding in an aircraft

151.content: What area are you flying over?
151.title: Military. riding in a helicopter

choices: You sleep through the night undisturbed
You wake up and se signs that something was there
1511.content:
You look out the open helicopter door at the lush, green forest rushing beneath your feet as you fly by. The co-pilot glances over his shoulder at you, "don't want to get lost down there" he says, "why's that?' you ask, "most of this forest is still unexplored and these trees would make it impossible to locate anyone from the air" he says. Suddenly a klaxon sounds and you turn your attention to the cockpit, "whats that?" you ask, "probably nothing, but I need you to stick your head out and check the tail for me" says the pilot. "How do you want me to do that?" you ask, "just strap into the floor there and stick your head out the door" says the co-pilot, you attach one of the safety straps to your belt and click it into the floor. You lean out the door slowly to look at the tail rotor, "come on I thought you airborne guys did this all the time?" yells the co-pilot, "yeah on airplanes" you yell back. "What's the difference?" he yells, "well for one this is a helicopter so we're at a lower altitude and I don't have a chute if I fall out, not that it would help." you yell back.

You look at the tail rotor and see nothing out of the ordinary so you climb back in, "I didn't see any---" you never got to finish because the whole helicopter lurched like someone had kicked it from behind, "what the hell was that?!" you yell over the klaxon, "we just lost the tail rotor!" yells the co-pilot. The helicopter began to spin counter-clockwise at a fast pace, "hold onto something Staff Sergeant!" yelled the pilot, you dive to grab one of the seats attached to the floor. Suddenly you feel the safety strap attached to the floor rip causing you to go flying out the open side door, "Oh Shi--------" was all you could say as you slid out the helicopter and toward the green forest floor below.

You braced yourself as you neared one of the giant pine trees, you crashed into the giant branches that slowed your fall to the ground below. You painfully slam into over ten different branches before finally hitting the ground with enough force to knock the wind out of you. You sit up and hear the sound of the helicopter rapidly losing altitude followed by the ground shaking and the sound of rotor blades snapping like they were plastic, but no explosion. You get to your feet and do a quick self-assessment before taking off in the direction of where you thought the helicopter went down.

You locate the crashed helicopter and are slightly relieved that it hadn't caught fire, you carefully make your way to the cockpit to check on the two pilots. What you see makes your heart sink, the pilot had a piece of metal through his chest, probably killing him instantly, you check on the co-pilot and discover that he was also dead due to a broken neck caused from the crash.

You sit down on a nearby rock as everything that just happened starts to sink in, "alright, first things first" you say to yourself. You carefully remove the pilots' bodies from the wreck and start digging two holes to bury them. You remove one of their dog tags and carefully lower them into the two holes that you dug, you fill in the graves and make markers using their dog tags, two sticks and some rope. You turn back toward the wreck to see what you could find that might help you, you find some MREs, a solar charger and some canteens of water so you take those, you still had your rifle and sidearm, both undamaged from your graceful fall from the helicopter, you grab some of the first aid kits and throw them in your bag.

Unfortunately your radio broke when you hit the ground and so did the pilots' in the crash, you manage to fit all the gear in your assault bag. You grab your rifle and bag and head out to try to find some shelter as it was beginning to get dark and you don't know what types of wildlife lived in these woods. As you walk you get the strange feeling that someone is watching you, but when you turn around there was no one, as you keep walking it starts to rain, you reach into your bag and pull out your poncho and put it on. you turned on your helmet light because the combination of the darkness and rain made it hard to see, as you walk you see a cave about 20 feet away.

The cave was small enough that you have you crouch down a little to get in, you drew your sidearm and looked around the cave for any signs that an animal was living here. After a brief search you find no evidence that anything was living in the cave so you put away your sidearm and set your gear along the wall and drift off to sleep.
1511.title: Forest

choices: Other( wolf, coyote, Tiger?, some type of canine or feline)
15111.content:
You wake up and look around, outside it was about midnight, you again had the feeling that someone was watching you. You turn on your helmet light again and look around the cave, seeing nothing you turn your attention to outside the cave. You get up and draw your sidearm and make your way outside, "hello?...is someone there?" you yell, no response so you walk back to the cave. You lay your bag on the ground to be used as a pillow and lean your rifle nearby in case you need it and you leave your holster unclipped so you you can get to it faster.

You lay down on your bag and drift back to sleep slowly, you are again woken, but this time it was almost dawn outside. You go to sit up, but you feel a weight across your left hip, this makes you freeze. You unhook your helmet light and turn it on, but you put your hand over the end and use your fingers to filter in some light so you don't disturb whatever is laying across you. As you shine your light you see that what was laying on you was a.........
15111.title: Something wakes you

151111.content:
As you shine your flashlight you realize that what was laying on you was a fox that was still asleep. "Well what the hell am I supposed to do now?" you think to yourself, you don't want to risk waking and startling this fox and have it potentially attack you. You sigh heavily, suddenly the fox starts to stir in its sleep, "crap" you think to yourself, the fox opens its eyes and looks around before looking up at you. You freeze, not sure what to do, the fox stands up and stretches before walking out of the cave, "that could have ended badly" you say to yourself.

You sit up and start packing whatever gear you took out last night, you reach over to grab your rifle, but as you lean back the fox had returned and was standing very close to you. You freeze and slowly move your hand to your holstered sidearm in case you need to use it. As your wrap your hand around the pistol grip a small voice in the back of your head is telling you to relax, you've come to trust that voice because its saved your life on more than one occasion.

The fox slowly walks closer to your face and opens its mouth, what happens next surprises you. The fox........
151111.title: Fox

1511111.content:
The fox begins licking your face the way a dog would, you sigh a big sigh of relief. You slowly reach your hand up to make the fox stop licking your face, "well this is different" you say as the fox lays down on you again. "Come on man can you get off me?" you ask hoping the fox would semi-understand what you said, the fox simply laid its head down on your lap. "Come on dude, can you please get up?" you ask again, the fox lets out a small growl, "well either he won't get up or he is a she" you think to yourself. "Can you get off me please umm..fox-lady" you say, the fox stands up and climbs off you, "well at least I now know your gender" you say to yourself.

You get to your feet and grab your gear,"well its been fun, but I've got to get going" you say to the fox as you leave the cave. The fox follows you out the cave and climbs to the top of the cave entrance, you give the fox a small wave and then turn to leave. You begin walking away from the cave, suddenly you feel something land on your shoulders, you turn your head to see the fox had jumped up on your shoulders, "what the?" you say. You've never seen a fox do something like this, you attempt to remove her from your shoulders, but she had wrapped her tail tightly around your arm. Despite your best attempts you couldn't unwrap the tail from your arm so you gave up and let the fox stay, "alright you've been nice to me, I guess I should do the same, I will how ever be needing my arm ma'am" you say to the fox and she unwraps her tail from your arm.

You continue walking with the fox laying across your shoulders for a few hours before you stop to eat some food for lunch. You lower yourself enough for here to jump off so you could set your bag down and pull out an MRE. The fox sits next to you and stares at you as you open your MRE, you look over and see she was giving you the begging-for-food stare. "I don't know if you'll like this" you say you scoop some of the entrée on your finger, "try this, if you like it I'll give you some" you say to the fox.

The fox smelled the food on your finger, suddenly she had your whole finger in her mouth up to the knuckle making you yell out in surprise expecting her to bite off your finger, but she didn't. "Ok, I guess you like it" you say, after you extract your finger you cut the entrée packet in two and open it so she could eat out of it, you pull out your metal canteen cup and pour some water in it for her to drink. The two of you finish your lunch, you clean out the metal cup and put it away along with your MRE trash and switch out your helmet with a boonie hat, "I don't think anyone is going to be shooting at me" you think to yourself. As you shoulder your bag the fox hops back on your shoulders again and lays down with her head near your left ear.

You turn and look at her, "comfy?" you ask her, a yawn answers your question, "look at me, I'm talking to a fox" you say to yourself. You continue walking with the fox on your shoulders, you look over at her and see she was starting to fall asleep. "Hey if I can't sleep, why do you get to?" you ask her, she lifts her head and licks the side of your face, "alright suck up" you say, you reach up and lightly scratch one of her ears, making her tail wag.
1511111.title: licks your face

15111112.content:
You continue walking with the fox draped on your shoulders, stopping occasionally to rest and every time you resumed walking she would hop back on your shoulders. "You are the laziest fox I have ever seen" you say looking at her on your shoulder, "and I'm talking to a fox, lost in the middle of an uncharted forest, and have no idea where I'm going, I think I'm going crazy" you say quietly. You continue walking for a couple more hours until you see something that sticks out from the trees, you make you way over to the object with your rifle at the ready.

As you get closer you realize it was a crashed military C-130 that looks like it had been here for years, you make your way to an opening in the rear of the plane and climb inside. Inside the rear of the plane were cargo crates still strapped to the floor and some vegetation growing sporadically on the inside of the cargo hold. You make your way to the cockpit in hopes of finding some type of working radio, but you don't get your hopes up because you know the chances of that are very slim to none.

You walk into the cockpit, there was no signs of the pilots' remains just empty seats and broken instrument panels. you begin digging around searching for anything, you open up a small compartment and find a folded piece of paper, you unfold it and read it. It was the manifest for the cargo, what surprised you was the date on the manifest, June 6, 1968, you walk back into the cargo hold and examine the crates that are still strapped to the floor. You cut one of the straps and open a crate, inside you found rows of M16A1 rifles that looked like they were made yesterday, but these rifle models were way outdated compared to your M16A4.

You walk over to another stack of crates that had a fire hazard symbol on it and the letters W.P. stamped on the top. You open this crate and saw rows of grenades sitting inside, you carefully take one out and see these weren't the usual baseball style grenades that you know, they were cylindrical with a rounded, cone-like bottom. They had the words WHITE PHOS. painted on the side, you carefully put the grenade back in its case, you have seen what kind of damage white phosphorus can do and you defiantly didn't want to be holding one of those grenades when it goes off.

"Well I think this plane will do for shelter for tonight" you say to yourself, you drop your bags and grab your folding survival shovel and head out to get some firewood. An hour later you were back at the crashed plane stacking wood to be lit, you pull out some potassium permanganate and a small bottle of glycerin from your survival pouch. You dripped a little glycerin on a branch and then sprinkled a small pinch of potassium permanganate on the glycerin and then stepped back, 30 seconds later the wood began smolder and one minute later you had a small fire going.

You turn around and see that fox was laying on the rear ramp watching you, you walk over and sit down next to her. You reach over and ruffle the fur on her head, she let out a small growl making you laugh, "If only you could talk back" you say to her. You reach into your chest pocket and pull out the manifest, you reach into your bag and pull out a flashlight and start searching the list hoping to find something that might help you survive in this forest. You see something that perks your interest, you put the manifest back in your pocket and head back into the cargo hold.

You shine your light over the different crates until you find what you are looking for, you unstrap the pallet and open a crate, inside were rows on C-rations. You remember your uncle talking about having these when he was in Vietnam, from what you remember they weren't any better than your MREs, but they would do. The sound of a footstep causes you to forget about the C-rations, you look and see the silhouette of someone standing at the rear of the plane, you stand and draw your sidearm, but you drop your flashlight as you stood up.

"Hello?" you say to the figure, "I'm not going to hurt you" says the figure in a female voice, "really?... then why were you trying to sneak in here?" you ask, "I wasn't trying to sneak in here, I just didn't want to scare you" says the figure. "Well I don't think that worked" you say, the figure started walking to you, "stop" you order, but the figure kept walking to you, you take a small step back, but your foot catches on a strap causing you to trip. You fall and hit your head on one of the other cargo pallets causing you to black out, the last thing you heard was the sound of someone running toward you and the feeling of being lifted up.

You open your eyes and see you were at back on the cargo ramp at the back of the plane, "your awake" you hear the same female voice from earlier say. You turn and see......
15111112.title: It starts to get dark

151111122.content:
A nine tailed fox sitting next to the fire, she was looking at you, "I think I hit my head really hard because now I'm seeing a talking fox" you say to yourself, she gets up and walks over to you, "no I'm real" she says. "Prove it" you tell her, she walks over and sits down next to you, "hmm...oh I know" she says, she leans over and kisses you on the cheek. You feel your face burn as you blush, she giggles "so is that enough proof?" she asks. "Well it proves one of two things, you're either a really good hallucination brought on by my head injury or....you are real" you say.

"That's good enough for me" she says, "What is your name" you ask, she smiles, "my name is Ember" she says. "Do you have a surname?" you ask, "yeah, but I don't really use it" she says, "well maybe sometime you could tell me" you say. "I bet I could guess your surname" she says, you cross your arms on your chest, "what are you betting?" you say, "well if I win, you do whatever I want for the rest of tonight and into tomorrow" she says, "and if I win?" you ask. "I have to do whatever you want for tonight and tomorrow" she says, "fair enough, go ahead give it you best guess" you say, she smiles "is it Grimm?" she guesses, you stare at her is shock, your arms drop back to your sides and your grin disappears.

"You can't read minds can you?" you ask, "well actually I can, but that's not how I guessed your last name" she says, "then how?" you say. She simply points to your chest, you look down and swear, stitched on your vest was your last name, "I didn't think this one out" you say. She laughs,"sorry I tricked you on that one" she says, you get to your feet and walk over to the fire to throw some wood on it to keep it going. "So what's your first name" she asks, "My name is John" you tell her, "I hate to pester, but do you have anything to eat?" Ember asks.

"Yeah that's what I was looking for before I hit my head" you tell her, you walk back into the cargo hold and grab the crate of C-rations that you found. You also find your flashlight and sidearm on the ground where you dropped them, you holster your sidearm and grab the crate of rations and walk back outside. "I don't know how well you'll like these, but they're all I've got" you tell her as you set down the crate. She gets up and picks up a ration to examine it, "so how are you supposed to eat these?" she says, "here let me help you" you say, she hands the ration to you and you open it for her.

She sniffs it, "It doesn't smell too bad" she says, she takes a small bite of the entrée, "I've had worse, but this is ok" she says. "Really?" you say, you open yours and try some of it, it wasn't that great, but it was better than nothing. The two of you sit and talk while you eat your rations, "so John, if it's not too rude what are you?...I've never seen your species before" says Ember, "I was going to say the same to you, but I'm a human" you say. "I've heard of your species, but you're the first one I've seen" she says, "let me guess....your a Kitsune?" you ask, she stops and looks at you, "very good, how did you know that?" she asks. "Like you I've heard stories about your race, but humans have never seen one for real" you tell her.

The two of you finish your meal and stack the empty ration cans near the fire pit, you grab your gear and walk back over to Ember, she was looking up at the stars in the night sky. "So how do we settle this bet?" you ask her as you sit down, "I don't know it was kind of unfair" she says, you think for a moment and then an idea pops in your head. "Ok how's this guess my nickname" you tell her, "What's the stakes?" she asks, "they're the same except instead of a day and a half, its three days and a half, sound good?" you say, she nods, "one other thing, no mind reading" you add.

"That seems fair" she says, she looks and your with a deep-in-thought expression on her face, for ten minutes straight she is quiet, "is it Reaper?" she asks. You stare at her in shock, "yeah, how did you guess that?" you ask still surprised, she shakes her head, "I really just guessed" she says, "ok well a bet's a bet, you win this time......again" you say. "Come on its getting late, we should go to sleep" she says, "yeah your right" you say, you get up and throw some more wood on the fire to keep it going for the rest of the night and walk back over to Ember. You grab your backpack to use as a pillow and lay down on the ground, Ember snuggles up to you, she drapes her massive tails across you like a blanket and lays her head on your chest, "goodnight John" she whispers as she drifts off to sleep, soon you begin to fall asleep.
151111122.title: A kitsune (multi-tailed fox)

choices: You run into trouble on the way
You make it to her home
1511111221.content:
You open your eyes and see the sun was just beginning to rise, you look down and see Ember was still laying on your chest asleep. You run your hand down her back causing two of her tails to move, you smile to yourself, "I was wondering when you would wake up" she says, "how long have you been awake" you ask. "Not that long" she says, she lifts her head and looks at you, "I was about to wake you" she adds, "oh? and how would you do that?" you inquire. "By doing this" she says, one of her tails starts to tickle your nose causing you to sneeze, "yeah that would do it" you say after she stopped tickling your nose.

"Come on lazy" she says as she gets off you, she walks over to the smoldering fire pit and starts poking at it, you get to your feet and stretch. You look over at Ember, with the sunlight out you could see her better than last night, her fur ran in random streaks of orange and white, 4 of her tails were orange with white tipped fur and the other 5 were white with orange fur on the tip. She had long black/brown hair on her head, she stood up and turned around to look at you revealing that she wasn't wearing anything. "You don't wear clothing?" you ask averting your eyes, "well normally I do, but it makes this difficult" she says you look back and see that she was gone, in her place was the fox that always rode on your shoulders.

"So that was you" you say, you could have sworn you saw the fox grin, before your eyes the fox transformed back into Ember. "Clothing does get in the way sometimes" she says, "well I could see how that could be a problem" you tell her. "Would you like some clothing for now?" you ask, she smiles, "if you could spare it that would be nice" she says. "I don't have any to spare, but maybe I could find something on the manifest" you tell her, she nods.

You pull the manifest out again and begin looking down the list, you get up and walk into the hold and begin digging through the different pallets and pulling crates out to the ramp. After digging for ten minutes you had 7 different sized crates outside the plane in a line. One by one you open them, "so what did you find?" Ember asks, "I found boots, socks, t-shirts, pants, belts, jackets, and hats" you tell her, she walks over and starts digging through the crates and trying on different articles of clothing. "Well these fit, but they don't really work with my tails" she says holding a pair of olive drab fatigue pants, "here give them to me" you say, she hands the pants to you as you pull out your knife and cut a small hole in the rear where her tails would be.

"Try that" you say handing them back, she puts them on and her tails fit perfectly through the hole, "better" she says as she laces up a pair of boots, you get up and head back into the cargo hold to see what you could find. You locate some A.L.I.C.E backpacks so you grab one and start throwing in some C-rations and anything else that you thought might be important, you refrain from any munitions because you couldn't trust their reliability. "Find something?" you hear you look up and see Ember standing by some crates, "just packing a bag to go, I'm just amazed that all this equipment is in such pristine condition" you tell her. "Come on lets get something to eat" she says, you follow her out of the hold where she had two C-rations open, as you walk into the sunlight you see she was wearing a full olive drab uniform with the sleeves rolled up to her elbows and a boonie hat on.

"You look uncomfortable with that hat on" you say, "its because it presses on my ears" she says, "here give it to me" you say, she hands the hat to you and you modify it like you did her pants, "there" you say handing the hat back. She put it on and her ears fit through the holes you cut in the top, "thanks again" she says as she hands you an open ration. "So what now?....." you ask, "what do you mean?" Ember asks, "Well I have no place to go, I'm not even supposed to be here" you tell her, she gives you a confused look. You explain to her how you became lost in the woods, how the helicopter you were riding in crashed, stranding you in the forest, when you finish the two of you sat in silence, after what seems like half an hour Ember breaks the silence, "you could stay with me" she says.

You look at her, "you trust me that much?" you say, "of course, besides if I can't trust you I'll just eat you" she says, you laugh, but as you see the look on her face your laugh turns into a nervous chuckle. "Ok...... how far away is your home?" you ask wanting to change the subject a little, "half a day's hike, if we leave in the next hour we can make it there before dark" she says. "Ok then we better get ready" you say, ten minutes later you were finishing packing the A.L.I.C.E. bag and leaving the cargo hold, "need me to carry anything?" Ember asks, "just the other bag" you say pointing to your assault bag.

You grab your rifle and follow Ember as she leads the way to her home......
1511111221.title: That morning

choices: There's a knock on the door
15111112212.content:
After walking for hours you arrive at Ember's home, her house was a log cabin styled building, "this is where you live?" you ask, "yep" Ember says. She walks over and opens the door for you, inside the door was a hallway with one room on the left and one on the right, as you walk to the end of the hall you found yourself in a living room/kitchen combo with a fireplace. "Well?" says Ember, "its nice, did you build it?" you ask, "most of it" she says, "how?" you ask confused, "thats a story for later, come I'll show you the rest of the house" she says. You walk over to her, "bathroom" she says indicating to one of the doors, "let me guess...your room" you say pointing to the other door, "yep, come on I have spare blankets and pillows in my closet" she says opening the door.

You stand in the doorway while she walks over to her closet, she stops and looks at you, "you can come in" she says, you walk in and sit on the foot of her bed. "Here you go" says Ember, she hands you a pillow and a blanket, "where do I sleep?" you ask, "well you can sleep on the couch or...." says Ember. "Or?...... or what?" you say, she flicks her eyes to her bed with a smile, "oh.....umm I think that..um..I'll...uh..take the....uh..t-the couch" you sputter as you stand, you manage to walk out of the room without tripping over your feet. You hear Ember laugh as you leave, "well the offer's still open if you change your mind" she yells from her room.

You walk out the the living room and set the pillow and blanket on the couch, you lean your rifle against the arm of the couch and you set the A.L.I.C.E. bag next to it. "crap" you whisper to yourself as you realize Ember still had your assault bag with her when she went into her room, you walk back to her room. Her door was still open, you stick your head in, on the floor were the clothing from the airplane, but Ember was no where to bee seen, "Ember?" you ask, "over here" you hear her say. You look and see her tails sticking out from behind a shoji screen with clothing draped over the top, "oh sorry" you say as you turn away, you feel a tap on your shoulder, you turn and look to see Ember standing there in baggy sweatpants and a tank top.

"You know someone who never seen humans you sure do dress like one" you tell her, she tilts her head in confusion, "never mind, you still have my backpack" you say. "Oh yeah, here" she says as she picks it up and hands it to you, "thanks" you turn to leave, " can I ask a favor" says Ember, "yeah, remember the bet we made?" you say. "Yeah well I still like to ask first" she says, "ok what do you need?" you ask, "well my feet are killing me from walking in those boots" she says "and you would like me to rub them?" you say, she smiles at you. She lays on her bed, you sit on the foot of the bed and start massaging her feet, "your good at this" she says, "really, because I've never had to do this" you tell her. An hour later you look over and see she had fallen asleep, she was completely relaxed, all nine tails lay limp across the bed, "maybe I am good at this" you think to yourself.

You carefully get off the bed and stand at the foot of the bed, you smile to yourself and take off your fatigue jacket and lay it across her like a blanket. You don't know why you did this, it just seemed right, you grab your bag and leave, slowly closing the door behind you. You walk back to the couch and lay down, seeing Ember asleep suddenly made you tired, you kick off your boots and grab the pillow she had given you and soon you were drifting off to sleep.
15111112212.title: You make it to her home

choices: Stay out, its not worth it
Curiosity gets the best of you
151111122121.content:
You wake up and see you were riding inside a Humvee, "sleep well Sergeant?" you hear, you turn and see your friend and spotter Corporal Henry looking at you. "No thanks to these roads" you tell him, he grins, "well be on alert, Bravo company got hit by IEDs on roads like these yesterday" he says. "Yeah well I don't thin--" you were interrupted by an explosion followed by your Humvee coming to a crashing halt, you cough on the dirt and smoke that filled the air inside the Humvee. "Everyone ok?" says the driver, "yeah we're good" you say, "dismount and setup a perimeter, I want this trigger man found" you hear over your radio, you open your door and get out, but you end up falling out as there was now a giant crater where the road was.

You climb out of the crater and back onto solid road to see how big the crater really was, "holy" was all you could say when you saw the extent of the crater, it was the size of an Abrams battle tank and if whoever detonated the bomb had waited a few more seconds your Humvee would be scattered all over the place in little pieces. You feel a tap on your shoulder making you turn around, standing there was your squad leader, "you good?" he asks, "yeah, whats the plan?" you ask.

"We think that IED was meant for one of the tanks" he says pointing to the three Abrams tanks in your convoy. Right now the tanks had their hatches open with commanders on their radios and loaders on their M240Bs scanning rooftops, "we can't move forward until EOD clears the rest of the road for anymore of those IEDs, until then keep your eyes open" says your squad leader. You look at the civilians that were watching your convoy, over the couple of months that you've been here you've figured out that if somethings about to happen the civilians seem to know when it will happen.

Right now their mood was generally calm, but that could change in seconds. An hour later EOD shows up and starts clearing the road for anymore IEDs, the whole time your attention was on the rooftops and the crowds of civilians milling about. Over the course of half an hour you noticed that the civilians were beginning to leave and in a hurry like they had somewhere better to be, you look over at your squad leader hand he looks at you and nods; he knows somethings up. Suddenly all hell breaks loose, bullets began landing all around you, followed by every Humvee returning fire with heavy M2 machine guns.

You raise your rifle and fire in the direction of the enemy fire, out of the corner of your eyes you see your squad leader fall, you turn and see him clutching his leg and shoulder. You sprint over to him, you pull out your medical kit and start treating his arm, Henry runs over and starts treating his leg wound. A medic runs over and helps treat the wounds, "I need someone to run back to the Humvee and grab my bag" he says, you look at Henry and he gets up and runs into the second Humvee in the convoy.

You look up and see an insurgent with an RPG peeking around the corner aiming at the Humvee Henry just ran into, quickly you get to your feet and begin running to the Humvee yelling for Henry to get out, but the insurgent fires and seconds later the Humvee explodes in a ball of fire. Next thing you knew you were flying backwards in the air and then you slammed into a stone pillar, you rolled on your back and looked up into the sky. Slowly your vision became blurry and began to darken, you hear the sound of boots running toward you and you see the outline of someone leaning over you, "John stay with me. come on you've got to stay awake" said the figure.

"John wake up" you hear the voice saying over and over, slowly the voice changes into a female's voice, "JOHN!" the voice says loudly, you open your eyes and find yourself in Embers living room on the couch. Ember was sitting on the couch looking at you with a concerned face, "what happened?" you ask, "you tell me, you were thrashing about repeating the name Henry" she says still staring at you, "I woke up to use the bathroom and heard you talking" she adds.

"Was it a nightmare?" she asks, "it was nothing" you lie, "who's Henry?" she asks, "I don't want to talk about it right now" you tell her. "Ok if you want to talk I'll listen" she tells you as she gets up and goes over to the fireplace to tend to the fire, you get up and walk into the kitchen section of the room to get a drink, you notice a door that you didn't see before. You start to open it, but Ember runs over and pushes it closed again, "please don't go in there, that's my one rule" she says, "sorry" you say.

"Come on I'll make something to eat" she says changing the topic, "ok what do you have in mind?" you ask, "something fresh, unlike those rations" she says walking toward the front door, "where are you going?" you ask. "Hunting" she says and she strips out of her clothing and turns into a fox and runs out the door leaving you alone. You look back at the door in the kitchen....
151111122121.title: You have a nightmare

choices: that morning: Ember's standing over you, and she looks pissed
1511111221212.content:
Against your better judgment you decide to open the door, iside was a set of stairs that led to what looks like a basement, you go back to the couch and put fyour boots back on and grab a flashlight. You walk down the stairs and find yourself in the basement, you shine the light around and see stacks of boxes, you seem drawn to one box on a table. You walk over and open it, inside was a picture, a book that looked like a diary and a small wind up musical box.

You look at the picture, on it were four foxes that looked like Ember, two adults and two children, you put the picture back, the diary was locked with a small lock so you put that back. You turn the crank on the music box, but no music plays, you shine the light in and see that two gear were broken, "maybe I could fix this for her, I think my watch has gears this size" you think to yourself. You hear a noise from upstairs, you quickly put the music box in your pocket and run up the stairs closing the door behind you.

You get upstairs expecting to see Ember, but no one was there, "must be my imagination" you say to yourself. You walk over to the couch and pull over the coffee table, you unhook your watch and using your multi-tool you start taking it apart. You carefully take the music box apart and insert the two gears from your watch, they fix perfectly, you put the box back together and turn the crank again winding up a little and then releasing the handle and it starts to play music for a few seconds before unwinding. "Well I think my work here is done" you say to yourself as you put the box in your bag to surprise Ember later.

Right after your clean up your watch parts, there was a knock at the door, you turn and see Ember standing there with her catch in her hands and a smile on her face. You get up and open the door for her, she walks into the kitchen and starts preparing a meal. An hour later you were sitting on the couch enjoying the meal she cooked, "this is really good" you say complementing her cooking, "thank you" she says, you notice the fur on her face visibly change. The two of you talk for hours after you finish eating, in the back of your mind you wanted to show her you fixed her music box, but you knew she might get made at the fact you broke her rule and went down the stairs.

"Well I'm going to bed" she says as she take care of the dishes, "ok good night' you tell her, "hey.. remember if you want to talk..." she says. "I know" you say, she smiles and walks to her room, you kick off your boots and lay on the couch. You reach into your bag and pull out the music box and turn it over in your fingers, you sigh and put it away, you close your eyes and drift off to sleep again.
1511111221212.title: Curiosity gets the best of you

choices: You are woken up to a commotion outside
There's someone else in the cave with you
15111112212122.content:
You open your eyes and see it was already morning out, you look up and see Ember standing over you, "good morning" you say, but as you look at her face you says that good was not on her mind. "What's wrong?" you ask, she continues staring at you, her face unchanged. "This is your one chance to come clean, did you open the door?" she asks, "crap" you think to yourself, you sit up and look at her, "yes I did" you say. She sighs, "thank you for being honest, but I'm still angry at you" she says, "Ember, I'm---" you begin, but Ember cuts you off, "why,..why did you do it, I gave you somewhere to go, food, a place to sleep and this is how you thank me, I had one rule and you broke it" she yells, the whole time you could see tears forming in her eyes.

She was trying hard not to break out crying, "Ember I'm sorry" you say, she shakes her head an walks to her room and slams the door shut. You stand up and walk to the door as you go to knock you can faintly hear her crying making you stop. You walk back to your bag and pull out the music box, you walk back to her room and knock on the door, "Ember?" you ask, no response. You open the door and peek inside, Ember was sitting on her bed with her back to you in the dark, "answer this for me...was it worth it?" she asks not looking at you, you look down at the music box in your hands, you set the box on the dresser by the door, "you tell me" you say as you leave, closing the door behind you.

*Ember's POV*

"What?" you say to yourself, you look over your shoulder and see he was gone, but he left something on your dresser. You get up and walk over to the dresser and turn on a light, you gasp as you pick up your music box from the dresser. You turn the handle and wind it up, you release the crank and it starts to play music, you start to tear up again, "he fixed it" you whisper. You open your door, "John" you yell, "John I'm sorry, I di--...John?" you walk to the living room, but he wasn't there, all his stuff was gone. You run outside to see if he was still there, but the only thing you saw were his boot prints in the dirt, you take off following his prints hoping to catch up to him.

*John's POV*

You've been walking for over four hours straight so you decide to take a break, you drop the A.L.I.C.E. bag and open it, inside was your assault bag, C-rations, two MRE's, three canteens and various other survival gear. You pull out an MRE ranger bar and a canteen, you sit thinking about your current situation, now you really have no where to go and no one to go to, you finish the energy bar and drink half a canteen before you resume hiking. Half an hour later it begins to rain, so you pull your poncho back out and put it on, You continue walking for almost another five hours and each hour the rain seemed to be getting worse so you decide to find some shelter for now, after walking for another hour you locate a cave that provided good enough shelter from the rain so you crawl in.

You set your gear on the ground and sit down next to it, slowly you drift off to sleep.....
15111112212122.title: that morning: Ember's standing over you, an...

151111122121221.content:
You suddenly wake up and look out the cave entrance, it was almost dusk out and the rain continued to fall, "I could have sworn I heard a scream" you say to yourself, you rest your head in your hand and close your eyes again. Just before you drift off again a loud scream rings out, jumping you awake, "that defiantly was a scream" you say as your grab your rifle and run out of the cave into the rain to investigate. You make it about twenty feet from the cave before you hear voices below you on the hill, "let go of me you pigs" you hear, "well look what we have here, someone like you shouldn't be out here at night", "yeah you could get hurt or worse you could run into us".

From what you could tell there were three people below you, two male and one female, slowly you make your way down the hillside to where the voices were coming from. You reach a boulder and hide behind it because just below you was where the voices were coming from, you peek over the boulder and see that you were right, there were two males and a female. The way the sun was you could see the three clearly, the two males were anthros like Ember, but they looked like wolves or coyotes, you froze when you saw that the mystery female was Ember, "she must have been looking for me" you think to yourself.

"Let me go!" she yelled, one of the males had her arms and tails pinned behind her while the other one stood in front of her and ran a finger across her chin, "you best watch yourself" he said. You couldn't let them do anything to hurt her, so you bring up your rifle and take aim above his head so that the bullet would harmlessly hit the tree behind him. You wipe the rain off your ACOG before taking aim and pulling the trigger, the branch above the second male's head exploded making him jump, "what the hell was that?!?" he yells in surprise, searching the hill.

"Let her go or the next one is going in your ear" you yell, "screw you man" yells the male that had Ember's arms and tails pinned. "Wrong answer" you whisper, as you look through your ACOG you see he was trying to hide behind Ember, but not knowing where you were he left himself completely exposed. You fired again and this time you were aimed so that the round hit the tip of his ear, he let out a scream of pain and clutched his right ear or what was left of it. "screw this lets get out of here" yells the other male, he grabs his partner and they run off into the forest leaving Ember alone.

You make your way to Ember, she couldn't see where you were until you were standing in front of her. She ran over and hugged you, her wet fur pressing up against you, "John I-I don-" you put up your finger stopping her mid-sentence, "lets get out of the rain first" you tell her, she nods and follows you back to the cave, you open your bag and hand her a wool blanket that you recovered from the plane wreck. "Thanks" she says wrapping herself in the blanket. "Why did you come looking for me?" you ask, she reaches into one of her pockets and pull out the music box you set on her dresser. "Listen I'm sorry, I overreacted" she says, "no I shouldn't have broken your rule" you tell her.

She slides over to you and wraps you up with the blanket and pulls you closer, "come on lets go back to my place" she says, "how? its pouring out and we're at least half a days walk away" you say. She grins at you, "I've got a few tricks up my sleeve, grab you stuff" she says, you pack up your bag and grab your rifle, she walks over to you and wraps her tails around you like a cocoon, "what ar-", "shh, just try not to move" Ember says cutting you off. A glowing light appeared around the two of you and you feel a sense of vertigo, Ember unwraps her tails and you found yourself in front of her house again, "sometime you have to explain that one to me" you say.

The two of you walk in the house, you set your wet gear down by the door while Ember goes into the bathroom and comes out with two towels and hands one to you. You follow her to her room,"do you mind helping me dry my tails? she asks, "sure" you say she sits down on her bed and you sit behind her and start drying her tails with the towel. "There" you says as you finish drying the last tail, suddenly she turns around and hugs you tightly, pulling your head into her ample bosom.

After what feels like an hour Ember releases you, "sorry" she says, "no its ok, you've had a crazy day" you tell her. "Well this day really knocked me out" you say as you get up to leave, but Ember grabs you with her tails and pulls you back on the bed. She lays on top of you, "maybe its better if you sleep here tonight" she says with a grin, you had to admit her fur was warming you up, "ok maybe just this once" you say, she lets out a small laugh, "we'll see" she says. She presses her muzzle under your chin and starts to drift off, moments later you start to drift off too.
151111122121221.title: You are woken up to a commotion outside

151112.title: Other( wolf, coyote, Tiger?, some type of canin...

1511121.content:
Using your flashlight you slowly reveal a tail, you feel your heart rate speed up as you realize whatever this was it was some sort of animal. As you slowly move the light you realize that the animal was a large mountain lion draped across your lap, you freeze in fear,"what the hell am I supposed to do now?!?!?" you think. You look to your right and see your rifle leaning against the cave wall, but it was too far away for you to grab it without disturbing the lion, you also couldn't reach you sidearm without risking waking up the lion. Your only option was your knife on the back of your belt, slowly you move your hand toward your belt and unclip your knife, the sound of unsnapping the clasp on your knife sheath was enough to wake the lion.

The lion stood up and walks over toward your face, quickly you draw your sidearm and fire a round straight up, the lion runs over to the other end of the cave. "What was that?!?" you hear the lion yell, you sit there shocked that you just heard a mountain lion talk, "you can..talk?" you ask, "only if you don't make that loud noise again" says the lion in a female voice, "ok only if you don't try to hurt me" you say. "I wasn't going to hurt you" says the lion, you reach over and turn on the flashlight on your rifle illuminating the cave, over in a corner was the mountain lion with her paws covering her ears.

"Ok I'm putting my weapon away" you say showing your sidearm to the lion as you holster it. She lowers her paws from her ears, "what do you mean you weren't going to hurt me" you ask, "just that I wasn't going to hurt you" she says" I just....who....why" was all you could say. "You're confused and scared aren't you?" says the lion, you nod, "well this might help" she says. In front of you the lion morphs into a human form, but still had the mountain lion features like the tail and fur.

"Do you have a name?" you ask, "Kathleen" she says, "ok Kathleen, my name is John" you say sticking your hand out, she hesitates, "what are you doing?" she asks confused. "Sorry, you don't shake hands do you?" you ask, she shakes her head, the two of you continue talking for over a hour, you notice that the whole time Kathleen moved closer to you, seeming no longer afraid of you and you also no longer had a deep fear of her for being a mountain lion. "Well Kathleen if you don't mind me asking, but how did you find me?" you ask, you see the fur on her face ripple, "I..uh..well I smell you" she said, you knew ever human had their own distinct scent that they gave off, you've seen police use dogs to track people using their scent to find them. "I was out hunting when I smelled your scent and followed it to this cave and found you asleep" she says.

"So how did you get here?" she asks, "well my helicopter had an accident and crashed in this forest" you tell her, "was that the loud boom I felt a couple hours ago?" she asks, "maybe" you say. "Was that also the giant metal...um thing that I found a couple miles that way?" she says pointing North, "no I crashed that way" you say pointing South. "Oh well I found something a few miles away from here that I've never seen before" she says, "there's another wreck?.....maybe I have a chance of getting rescued" you think to yourself, "can you take me there?" you ask, Kathleen nods, "in the morning though I hate navigating in the dark" she says.

"Ok we should probably get some sleep" you tell her, you reach over and turn of the flashlight plunging the cave back into darkness, you grab your bag and make a makeshift pillow with it. Just as you lay down you feel a presence behind you, you sit up and turn on the flashlight again and see Kathleen laying down behind you, "what?" she says looking at you. "Nothing its just that I've never fallen asleep this close to a mountain lion before" you say, "you know you can sleep closer to one" she says with a small grin. "What ar--" before you could finish she wraps her arms around you and hugs you close to her, "only if you don't try to eat me" you say.

She lets out a small laugh, "no promises" she jokes, you reach up and turn off the flashlight and again plunge the cave back into darkness. The only noises you hear are the sounds of your and Kathleen's breathing as you drift off to sleep.........
1511121.title: Mountain lion

15112.content:
You enjoy a night of uneventful sleep, the next morning, after a brief breakfast, you decide that the best thing to do is to ascend the mountain and try to get your bearings. You pack up your gear and start the long hike up the side of the mountain, after about twenty minutes of walking you start to encounter snow. "Odd I didn't think I was high enough on the mountain to start to see snow" you say to yourself, but as you look around you notice it was snowing all over the forest. You continued up the mountain, soon the snow started to become more intense as you continued hiking. At one point you had the feeling of being followed, but when you turned around there was no one around, finally after about a two hour hike you manage to reach a clearing in the mountain that allowed you to see for miles in all directions. You pull out your map and compass and attempt to find your location, but nothing seemed to match up, it was if the forest didn't exist.

Suddenly the sound of crunching snow grabbed you attention, you spin around and standing about ten feet away from you was a grey wolf that seemed to be checking you out. Just then you spot another wolf standing on a small ledge watching you, as you watched the two wolves you spot a third, then a fourth, before you knew it you had about eight wolves staring at you. "oh shit" you whisper to yourself as you yank on your rifle's charging handle and flick the selector switch to full auto. You were too busy watching the wolves that you failed to watch you footing because as you stepped backwards you took a tumble down the snow covered mountain, on reflex you pulled the trigger and let off three or four round harmlessly into the air. After falling for what felt like forever, you finally come to a rest on your back in some snow, you black out from your graceful fall and when you come to your find yourself.....
15112.title: You sleep through the night undisturbed

choices: A wolf walks over and speaks to you
One of the wolves is in heat
"What's that in the back of the cave?"
151122.content:
When you open your eyes you find yourself in some sort of cave, as you come to your senses you find that you all your gear is missing and you are covered in some sort of blanket with a fuzzy pillow under your head. Just then you noticed your "pillow" was slowly moving up and down, like it was breathing, you look over and see it was one of the wolves that you saw on the mountain. You turn your attention to the blanket that covered you and you noticed it was the rest of the wolves laying on top of you, keeping you warm with their fur and body heat. The wolf that was laying across your chest stirred in its sleep and woke up, it looked around the cave a little before noticing that you were awake. It started sniffing your face, you remained frozen, waiting for this wolf to take a bite out of your face, but instead it started to lick your cheek and then rub it's cheek against your's.

You learned somewhere that it was a wolf's way of trusting you or something like that, which in your case, was a good thing. The wolf repositioned itself so its head was facing you when it laid back down, soon it drifted back off to sleep. "What now?" you say to yourself, "I'm trapped under all these wolves, but they don't seem to want to harm me, wish is odd" you think to yourself as you look around the cave. Just then, somewhere on the pile of wolves, you felt one wake up and it walked over to the wolf that was currently your "pillow" and nudged it awake. The two of them had some sort of conversation, which consisted of short, quiet growls and grunt-like noises, suddenly your "pillow" started to stand up slowly and the other wolf was forcing its way under your head, thats when you realized they were switching spots so you helped by tilting your head forward and allowed the other wolf to become your new pillow. The wolf that was your first pillow got up, sniffed your face and did the same lick and rub thing that the wolf on your chest did before walking away.

Over the course of an hour a random wolf would wake up, walk over to you, sniff and lick your face before rubbing up against you and then would either walk away or would lay back down on you.
151122.title: In a cave

choices: The blue eyed wolf does something
1511223.content:
Eventually the wolves let you stand up, you get a count and make out at least fifteen wolves walking or sitting around the cave, but every so often a wolf would leave or two would walk in. You decide to look around the cave, the cave was about 10-20 feet tall so you could stand without having to crouch down.
