You dig through your gear and find your night vision goggles and attach them to your helmet, that way you can walk into the dark building without using a flashlight and risk whatever was in there finding you. Slowly you open the front door and enter with your rifle raised, slowly you sweep from side to side and see nothing, you saw obvious signs that something was here recently, you look at the ground and see that it had foot prints, but these prints look like they were made be some type of animal.

Slowly you continue walking into the building, if you had to guess this building looks like it was at one time a wood or metal workshop. You hear a loud crash come from one of the other rooms above you, the sound of footsteps seem to be heading towards what look like stairs. "Oh crap" you think to yourself as the footsteps draw near, you look around and find a small storage closet, quickly you run in and quietly close the door behind you. You lift you night vision goggles and put the gas mask back on, unfortunately you can't use the goggles and the mask at the same time so you can only sit in the dark closet and pray that whatever was out there doesn't find you.

You hear the footsteps walk by the door and fade away, you stay hidden in case it returned, sure enough not two minutes went by before the footsteps come back and stop out side the door. You reach for your bayonet on your vest to defend yourself in the small room, but the footsteps leave without touching the door. Quietly you remove your mask and don the goggles again, you open the door slowly, on the ground around the door were more of those footprints, but thankfully they seem to be leading towards the front door. "Whatever that thing was its gone" you say to yourself, after a brief search you locate a basement and from the lack of footprints in the dirt, this was the best place to stay for the night.

You make your way downstairs and find a secluded area of the basement to sleep for the night that won't leave you laying out in the open in case that thing returns. You lay in a corner and set your gear down with your rifle draped across your legs and your backpack as a pillow, soon you close your eyes and drift off to sleep...........
1513211.title: Go inside the building

choices: The strange figure catches up to you
15132112.content:
You open your eyes and see the sun was just beginning to rise,"just a few more minutes of sleep won't hurt you think to yourself. You roll back over and snuggle up with the fuzzy blanket, slowly you drift back off to sleep. Suddenly you open your eyes,"I don't have a fuzzy blanket" you whisper to yourself, slowly you look around and find yourself surrounded by soft, warm fur, as you sit there silently you hear light snoring and feel movement, like you were laying on someone. As you sit up you find a furry arm draped across your chest and a pair of furry legs across your legs.

Unfortunately there wasn't enough light to tell who or what was sleeping next to you, slowly and carefully you remove the arm from your chest and slide your legs free. You locate your rifle and backpack and slowly you stand up and make your way towards the stairs, taking care not to disturb the sleeping figure. You silently ascend the stairs and stop at the top to make sure the figure was still asleep, which it was, as you look forward you can make out the front door on the other end of the room, in front of you was a bunch of random metal and wood shop machines; saw, presses, and lifts.

You take a small step forward, but your boot hits and knocks over a can of nails that make a loud noise as they spill across the floor. "Who the fuck leaves a can of nails by a door?!?! you whisper loudly to yourself, suddenly you hear the figure below begin to wake, "screw this" you say as you run towards the front door. You hear the figure get up and make its way up the stairs as you jump and slide over a work table before whipping open the front door and take off running down the street. You keep running in a random direction away from the building and from the strange being inside.....
15132112.title: The next morning

choices: "I'm a little tired from that run"
151321121.content:
You continue running down the street, when suddenly something tackles you from the left and grabs onto you, sending you rolling down the sidewalk. As you come to a stop on your back you see that what tackled you was a cheetah, but this cheetah had human features. The cheetah still had its arms around your chest as it raised its head and looked at you, "tag you're it" it said in a female voice with a smile, "what?" you say shocked that it just spoke perfect english. "I said tag you're it" she repeated, "wait, you're not going to hurt me?" you say confused, "why would I hurt you?" she asks tilting her head to the left slightly.

"Well because you're...umm" you say struggling for the polite word to describe her, "an animal?, a monster?" she says finishing your sentence as she climbed off you, "I was going to say different" you tell her as you sit up. She shrugs, "same thing" she says, "why did you chase me?' you ask, she grabs her left arm and rubs it nervously, " I...uh..well you're the first person I've seen in a long time and I liked having someone else as company and...well..yeah" she says nervously. "I'm guessing you want me to stay?" you ask, "well..I mean if---you know--if you want to" she says nervously.

You sit there and think for a minute, the whole time you were thinking you could see the cheetah fidgeting nervously as she waited for your response. You look at her and nod, "I'll stay" you tell her, in the blink of an eye, she grabbed you and hugged you close to her, you could hear her purring loudly as she squeezed you tightly, You feel her soft furry chest press up against your face the whole time she was hugging you, it was a little odd considering you don't even know her name yet, but somewhere in the back of your mind you liked it. "Umm ma'am can you let me go?" you ask, "oh sorry" she says as she lets go of you, "its just I'm a little excited you decided to stay" she says.

"Its ok, um if you don't mind me asking since I'm going to be staying, but what's your name?" you ask. She smiles at you, "my name's Matahari, but you can call me Matty for short if you like" she says, "my name's Paul" you say holding out your hand. Matahri shake you hand and helps you to your feet, "why did you say "tag you're it" when you tackled me?" you ask, you see the fur on Matahari's face flutter, "umm I really don't know, it was just the first thing that popped in my head at the time" she says.

You follow Matahari back to the workshop that you ran from earlier, but this time she takes you upstairs instead of the basement. The upstairs was completely different from the first floor in many ways, the second floor was like an apartment, it had one large room and a small hallway off to the side. Inside the large room was a kitchen/living room/ bedroom combo, the couch in the middle of the room had a bed unfolded from it and off to the left was a small kitchen. "You can set your things over here" says Matahari pointing to an empty corner of the kitchen, "so what do you want to do first" you ask Matahari, she looks at you.......
151321121.title: The strange figure catches up to you

151322.content:
From your hiding spot you watch the front door open and something or someone walk inside then silence, the only other noise you heard was your quiet breathing through the gas mask. You make out the outline of a figure walking into the room, it was odd watching this figure as it looked like it was..."sniffing" you whisper to yourself. Suddenly the figure looks in your direction with glowing, animal-like eyes, you hear your heart rate increase in your ears as you watch the figure make its way toward you.

You ready yourself to run if the figure discovers you, the figure starts digging around in the rubble near you. You contemplate between staying put and wait this out or running for it and hope that the figure doesn't catch you.
151322.title: The door opens

choices: The next morning: theres something in the building
The figure from earlier found you
1513222.content:
You lay in wait for the right moment to make a run for the door when the figure had its back to you, just then the figure turns around and you make your move. As fast as you can you jump to your feet and run out of the room, the figure turns around and lunges at you, but misses you by inches. You reach the front door and run outside in a random direction, you didn't care which way so long as you were away from whatever just lunged at you. You keep running for over an hour before diving into an ally to catch your breath as it was difficult to breath with the gas mask on.

You rip the mask off and take deep breaths of fresh, unfiltered air to catch your breath, "what was that thing?" you say to yourself. Suddenly you hear the sound of something running and it was getting close to you, "that thing must have followed me" you say. You dive into the nearest open building and again hide under some rubble to conceal yourself, you pull the gas mask back on again as you hear the mysterious figure run by the window, stop to look in, and then resume running.

You let out a sigh of relief that you were safe for now, you crawl out of the rubble and search for a secure place to sleep for the night. You find a room that offered the best form of protection for the night, you grab some boards and barricade the door an window before settling down for the night.
1513222.title: Run

choices: Someone else is pounding on the door
15132222.content:
Just as you settle in and start to dift off to sleep you hear a noise coming from one of the other rooms, you grab your rifle and hide behind whatever rubble you could find. Suddenly something heavy hits the barricaded door making you jump you take aim at the door and tighten your grip on the rifle, again something heavy slams into the door making it creak. You get ready to defend yourself and wait.....and wait........and wait, suddenly whatever was hitting the door seemed to have stopped so you get up to investigate, but before you could get to the door something came crashing through the window knocking you over and making you lose your rifle.

You lay there and see that what came crashing through the window was the figure from earlier and as the moon light came in you could make out more features like the figure was definitely female, it had pointy ears on its head and a tail of sorts. The figure looked at you with the same animal-like eyes from before and this time she could definitely see you, you quickly drag yourself across the floor to get away from her. Before you know it you find yourself in a corner with the figure walking toward you, you reach and draw your M9 sidearm and point it at her, she stops for a second, but resumes walking toward you.

You cock the pistol, but she doesn't stop this time, she stops in front of you and gets down to your height and slowly she sets her hand on the pistol and pushes it away. Every instinct was telling you to shoot, but for some reason you couldn't, but as she reached to remove the mask you stopped her, "its ok, I'm not going to hurt you" says the figure. Something in her voice made you relax and she again started to remove the mask, she took the mask and set it on the ground next to you. Even without the mask obscuring your vision, you still couldn't tell what the figure was, she wrapped her arms around you and pulled you close to her in a sort of hug with her tail wrapping around you. At first you thought she was trying to smother you, but she wasn't grabbing you tightly, "wha-" you start, "ssshh, rest now, tomorrow you will get your answers" says the figure.

For some reason you begin to relax and despite your best effort you drift off to sleep..........
15132222.title: The figure from earlier found you

151322221.content:
You open your eyes and see that the sun was just beginning to rise, "what a dream" you say to yourself. You look around the room and see the shattered window, suddenly you realized that what happened wasn't a dream. You look around and find that you are alone again and the barricaded door was now open. Quickly you locate your pistol and gas mask from the ground, you look over and see your rifle on the floor on the other side of the room. You quietly get up and make your way over to the rifle, stopping at the open door to peek into the hallway, you retrieve the gun from where it fell the previous night.

You hear a noise coming from the hallway, you quickly spin around with your rile at the ready, standing in the doorway was a............
151322221.title: The next morning

1513222211.content:
You see the glowing-eyed creature from the night before, but you are better able to make her out in the daylight that streamed through the windows and door. She seems to be a combination of a woman and a wolf, like nothing you've ever seen before. She has a distinctly animal face, but it has a certain softness to it. Her fur is grey tipped with black, and the clothes she wears are tattered and torn.

Remembering last night, you decide that she has not shown herself to be a threat so far. She speaks first. "My name is Ima. What's yours?" You introduce yourself as Michael Yorkson, to which she responds, "Well, 'Michael Yorkson,' if it's not too much trouble, can I ask how you got here? You're clearly not from the area." You describe the events of the crash, and Ima listens with concern evident on her face. When you finish the story, she looks crestfallen. "I'm sorry... Here I'd hoped..." She trails off, and though you don't want to pry, you can't help but ask. "Hoped what?" After a pause, she goes on. "Well, it's silly, now that I think about it. But I'd hoped the quarantine was over.

"I was meaning to ask," You start, "Why is this place quarantined?" The expression that crosses Ima's face tells you that she's trying to figure out how to phrase it. "Our city was hit by a bomb. They thought it was carrying a disease, so they closed everything off- it was just supposed to be until they could make sure nobody was sick. But then we lost all contact with the world outside. It's like they forgot about us."

While you're still not sure you understand, you decide to let it go. The two of you sit in silence for a while, before Ima says, "Say, why don't I show you around town?" Agreeing that it sounds like a good idea, you follow her out the door. The first place the two of you visit is...
1513222211.title: Wolf

choices: She takes you to meet her family
She takes you to her home
15132222122.content:
Standing in the door way was a gray, nine tailed fox with the same glowing eyes from last night, you lower your rifle a little, "who are you?" you ask, "my name is Miko, and I'm not here to hurt you" she says with the same calm voice from last night. "If your not here to hurt me, than why are you here?" you ask, lowering your rifle a little more, "well I saw the crash and I followed you because I was curious" she says. You completely lower your rifle, "come follow me" she says waving toward the door, you hesitate, "where?" you ask.

"Just trust me" she says as she turns and leaves, you let out a small sigh before following her outside, "I have to ask, why did you smash through the window?" you ask. "I thought that someone had captured you and were holding you prisoner" she says, "so she's concerned about me. I guess thats a good thing....right?" you think to yourself. After walking around for an hour you stop outside another boarded up building, "come on" Miko says opening the front door.............
15132222122.title: Kitsune

151322221221.content:
As she opens the door to the building you see four other kitsunes that looked like Miko standing around, "wait here" Miko says, gesturing you to wait. She walks over and starts talking to a tall, male kitsune, the whole time they were talking the male kept looking over at you. After about an hour of talking the male let out a small sigh and nodded, Miko walked back to you, "who was that?" you ask, "my father" she says. "Here let me introduce you to everyone else" she says, you follow her over as she introduces you to her mother and two sisters.

"So your the oldest?" you ask after you introduce yourself to the last family member, "no I'm the middle one" she says. "really, the three of you look the same age" you say. She laughs, "its because we were all born minutes apart" she says, "so how does you mother tell you apart?" you ask. She points to what looks like a scar that runs across her right eye, but as you look closer you realize that it was a length of white fur and not a scar. "My older sister has a patch of white fur on her forehead and my younger sister has a patch on her muzzle" she says.

"Come, my father says that if you are to stay here, you have to help us gather food and supplies just like the rest of us" she says.......
151322221221.title: She takes you to meet her family

choices: Miko's sisters decide to join the fun
1513222212212.content:
You return to the house later that day exhausted from scavenging all around the city for food and water, "not a bad run" says Miko. You look at what you found, three jugs of water and about twenty cans of food total, you even managed to find a fresh set of blankets to stay warm at night. As you walk in the front door Miko's mother walks over and looks at what you found, " oh what a nice find" she says taking the blankets. Miko's mother looks at you, "why don't you go lay down, you look tired" she says, you laugh "I feel tired" you tell her, she looks over at Miko, "Miko will you find a place for our guest to rest" she says.

Miko nods, "I was planning on resting a little also" she says, Miko's mother looks at her and then at you and seems to be putting two and two together because she gives the two of you a big smile. Your too tired to make any sense of what was going on so you just walk away to find a place to sleep, Miko walks up behind you and steers you toward a small, empty room in the back of the house. "Let me guess, your room?" you say as you walk in, "yep" she says, you shrug and find a spot on the floor to sleep. "Why are you laying over there, there's a mattress over here" says Miko, you look up and see on the other side of the room was Miko sitting on a small bare mattress.

"Sorry I'm just so tired I could sleep anywhere" you tell her, she lets out a small laugh, "here maybe I can help" she says. Suddenly you feel her tails snaking their way around your body and lifting you up and pulling you toward the mattress, she sets you on the mattress. She lays herself on top of you giving you a good view of her chest, but your eyes were locked with hers, she leans forward and gives you a long lasting kiss, to you it was a bit odd because of the fur on her muzzle tickling your nose. She wraps her arms around your head and rests her head under your chin, you run your fingers through the fur on her sides making her twitch, "stop it that tickles" she says into your ear. "Thank you for letting me stay here" you say, Miko smiles and gives you a soft squeeze with her tails, "its the least I could do" she says, you close your eyes and soon drift off to sleep...........
1513222212212.title: Later that evening

151332.content:
You peer out of the helicopter at the stretch of ice and snow below you. Even with your face covered, the cold stings at your eyes, and you quickly lean back in. Turning to the pilot, you speak with disdain. "Is it really that important that we come all the way out here?" Without turning back to look at you, he responds, "Look, I don't care much for it either, but there's nothing we can do." He's right of course, you think to yourself. It was the kind of assignment that wasn't worth arguing about. That didn't mean you had to enjoy it. "Honestly, I'm not sure why-"

You're interrupted as the helicopter jolts. There's a loud clang, like it's been stuck by something, and a horrible grinding noise followed by the acrid smell of smoke. Before you can ask what's going on, the pilot speaks with a commanding tone. "We're losing altitude fast!" You see him frantically working the controls, but the sight is quickly obscured by thick black smoke. You grab an oxygen mask off the wall, holding on to a grip on the wall with all your strength. The craft swings to the side, and you are nearly thrown to the ground. The pilot shouts something, but you can no longer hear. You barely register that you can see the ground, even from where you're standing.

When you wake up, you can't immediately tell where you are. The you are still wearing the mask, though it has been cracked, and it's been severed from the craft. There is a pressure against your lower back- while you are lying underneath something, you don't seem to be pinned. The air still smells of smoke, and you can't seem to register sound normally. You pull yourself free from the wreckage, across the ice which seems to have melted, leaving it damp. Once you've cleared the helicopter, you remove whats left of the oxygen mask and roll onto your back to survey what's left of the helicopter..

The first thing you notice is that the tail cone has separated completely. The helicopter his heavily dented and bent out of shape- you see that it's buckled in on itself. The top sticking down must have been the pressure you felt. The cockpit is surrounded by shattered glass, and you cannot see the pilot. Looking up at the main rotor, you can see something tangled around it, but it's impossible to make out just what it is.

You get up and check yourself for injuries, and don't find anything too serious. You're sore, and you've got plenty of cuts and bruises, but you know enough basic first aid to manage. With that in mind, you walk gingerly back to the helicopter to see what you can salvage. You find your gear mostly intact, as well as the helicopter's first aid kit. Using the wreckage as shelter, you clean and bandage your cuts, and quickly change into cleaner and drier clothes. You'd still look a mess to anyone who saw you, but at least you won't catch hypothermia or anything. You lean heavily against the helicopter, trying to make a plan. Then...
151332.title: Arctic

152.content:
You are riding in a sizable passenger plane, but it's largely empty. Your flight left early in the morning, to a place few people have cause to visit.

What sort of an area are you flying over?
152.title: Civilian. riding in a plane

info.brief_description: Your aircraft goes down due to mechanical failure and crashes in uninhabited land or is it
info.description:
You are traveling by air when suddenly you aircraft suffers a mechanical failure and crashes into the ground below.

1.All types of anthros are allowed, but must be human sized.
2.Main character can be military, civilian, whatever.
3.Sex is allowed, but don't over do it.
4.The area where you crash can be any place, (desert, jungle, forest) doesn't matter.
5.Characters can die, but leave an option open where they live.
6.Swearing is allowed.
7.Vore is allowed.
8.Anthros can transform into animals.
9.If you have any questions feel free to message me.
10. any vehicle from 1950-modern day can be used, setting is modern day.
info.pretty_title: You crashland in an area with Anthros
